phrases: Hello! It's nice to meet (like this).
We can gladly discuss that.
Have you heard that our friend is leaving the city?
I think we should have a farewell party.
What is your opinion on this news?
I suggest that we celebrate on the weekend.
Should we hold the party in the park or at your/my place?
How about a barbecue?
I would have time on Saturday.
Let's organize the party in the park.
Friday evening would be better, as most people have Saturday off.
Maybe we could have a picnic instead?
Shall we organize a buffet?
I'm in favor of a restaurant; that would be simpler.
What is the main thing we need to organize?
We need to talk about the trip.
How about doing it next week?
I have an idea: We could go hiking.
Perhaps we should first check the weather forecast.
Let's start with the date.
We could invite Peter and Sarah, too.
I suggest we meet next Monday.
How about 8 o'clock?
We could try a new approach this time.
groups.name: Opening & Making Suggestions

phrases: When exactly should we do this?
Where exactly?
Does the date suit you?
What do you think of this idea?
I don't know if that's a good idea.
I have a better suggestion.
Wouldn't it be better if we did it indoors?
I'm not sure if I have time on Friday.
That is unfortunately difficult for me.
I'm afraid that will be too expensive.
Do you prefer it if we order pizza instead of cooking?
Could you perhaps postpone the date?
Don't you think the weather will be bad?
I would prefer something lighter to eat.
What exactly do you mean by 'buffet'?
I suggest I ask three colleagues. What do you think?
What exactly are the requirements?
Do you have another suggestion?
Could we maybe change the location?
Instead of Saturday, how about Sunday?
What if we started earlier?
I think that might be complicated.
Are you sure that's enough food?
What kind of music do you think we should have?
Is it really necessary to book a restaurant?
What's your alternative suggestion?
groups.name: Asking Questions & Counter-Suggestions

phrases: That is a good idea!
I like that.
That sounds perfect.
I agree.
Great! / Wonderful!
Exactly!
That suits me well.
Who can take that over?
I can gladly take that over.
I'll take care of it.
I'll cover the cost of the meat.
What else needs to be done?
You could organize the music, couldn't you?
I'll make the invitations and send them by email.
That is fair!
Have we discussed everything?
I think we are finished with the planning.
Then, here is the plan:
Great that we clarified that!
We'll see each other on Friday evening then!
I'm really looking forward to it!
I totally agree.
That sounds like a great plan.
I'll reserve the location.
You can rely on me.
So, we've settled on the date and place.
Let's summarize what we decided.
I'll send you a confirmation email later.
It's settled then.
I'll buy the tickets.
Is there anything else we should think about?
groups.name: Organization & Conclusion
